citations.narrative:
The complete acquisition information (address) for two golden retrievers (#1006 and #1009) was unavailable on form
7005. Complete acquisition information is required and can be important in the need of animal health tracking. Ensure
that acquisition number for dogs is complete for dogs on hand.
Correct by 7/25/2021.

The area where food and bedding is stored had loose dust and litter on the floor. Areas around food and bedding that
aren't kept clean could cause contamination of food and bedding. Ensure that the areas where food and bedding are
stored are kept clean and stored in a manner that protects the supplies from spoilage, contamination, and vermin
infestation.
Correct by 7/24/2021

Some plywood on the walls of two different enclosures that dogs can contact is not sealed and is not impervious to
moisture. Surfaces that dogs touch that are not impervious to moisture can become soiled quickly and cannot be
sanitized. Ensure that the surfaces dogs can contact are maintained impervious to moisture.
Correct by August 10, 2021.

The facility reports changing attending veterinarians and remembers the new veterinarian approved a written program of
veterinary care, however was not able to locate it. To ensure adequate veterinary care is planned for and can be
provided, the program of veterinary care for dogs must be in writing, signed by the attending veterinarian and available for
inspection by APHIS officials.
Note: The facility had documentation that the new veterinarian has made regularly scheduled visits and said they have
scheduled the veterinarian to visit and complete another Program of Veterinary Care in the case the previously approved
progam can't be located.
Correct by 7/26/2021
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
2.75(a)(1)(i) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The complete acquisition information (address) for two golden retrievers (#1006 and #1009) was unavailable  on form 
7005.  Complete acquisition information is required and can be important in the need of animal health tracking.  Ensure 
that acquisition number for dogs is complete for dogs on hand. 
 
Correct by 7/25/2021. 
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The area where food and bedding is stored had loose dust and litter on the floor.  Areas around food and bedding that 
aren't kept clean  could cause contamination of food and bedding.  Ensure that the areas where food and bedding are 
stored are kept clean and stored in a manner that protects the supplies from spoilage, contamination, and vermin 
infestation. 
 
Correct by 7/24/2021 
3.3(e)(1)(iii) 
   
Sheltered housing facilities.

Some plywood on the walls of two different enclosures that dogs can contact is not sealed and is not impervious  to 
moisture.  Surfaces that dogs touch that are not impervious to moisture can become soiled quickly and cannot be 
sanitized.  Ensure that the surfaces dogs can contact are maintained impervious to moisture. 
 
Correct by August 10, 2021. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility reports changing attending veterinarians  and remembers the new veterinarian  approved  a written program of 
veterinary care, however  was not able to locate it.  To ensure adequate veterinary  care is planned for and can be 
provided,  the program of veterinary care for dogs must be in writing, signed by the attending veterinarian  and available for 
inspection by APHIS officials. 
 
Note: The facility had documentation that the new veterinarian  has made regularly scheduled visits and said they have 
scheduled the veterinarian  to visit and complete another Program of Veterinary Care in the case the previously approved 
progam can't be located. 
 
Correct by 7/26/2021 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
End Section
